results.title: The Carnot cycle and the Kelvin temperature scale
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “College Physics”.
The motion of a piston in a cylinder and a moving point on a pressure-volume diagram are used in explaining the four ideal processes which constitute the Carnot cycle. Shows heat being absorbed and rejected during the cycle and defines the Kelvin scale.

results.title: Carnival in Quebec
results.creator_credit: Jean Palardy, Roger Blais and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A colorful record of Quebec City’s winter carnival - with all the fun and frolic of a southern Mardi Gras but in gleaming winter setting. Fine examples of snow sculpture, pageants, parades, sporting events, a torch-light parade on skis, folk dancing and fireworks, fill three weeks of festivities and pay due respect to King Winter.

results.title: Carnarvon
results.brief_description: Aboriginals of central Queensland left cave paintings and rock engravings in the caves of the Carnarvon ranges. Today the Aboriginals are gone and the true meanings of the many unique designs may never be known.
results.description: Aboriginals of central Queensland left cave paintings and rock engravings in the caves of the Carnarvon ranges. Today the Aboriginals are gone and the true meanings of the many unique designs may never be known.

results.title: Carmen
results.creator_credit: Lotte Reiniger, Carl Koch and Primrose Productions
results.brief_description: This film is one of Lotte Reiniger’s early films which can be described as a short pastiche on the opera story, in black and white silhouettes. The story is about Carmen, who entices the soldier Don Jose to the gypsy encampment where she steals his clothes. Disgraced and ashamed, Don Jose follows Carmen to a bullfight, but she escapes into the bullring and is carried triumphantly around the ring on the back of the bull. Designed and animated by Lotte Reiniger with music by Bizet.

results.title: Carmen
results.brief_description: Bizet’s tragic opera, sung in Italian. One of a series of opera films which feature the chorus and orchestra and some of the principals of the Rome Opera House, La Scala, Milan and other famous Italian opera companies. Combines scenes from a performance of the opera with an English language commentary which explains the plot and action.

results.title: Carl Milles: Swedish sculptor
results.creator_credit: Doreen Denning, A B Nordish Filmkopici and Radio Sweden
results.brief_description: Carl Milles was perhaps one of Sweden’s most famous sculptors. After a survey of the artist - including some unique scenes of his early works, the film takes us on a tour of the Millesgarden where a number of his works are displayed. Following his death, Millesgarden was donated to the State and is now one of Stockholm’s most frequented museums.

results.title: Caring for the mind
results.creator_credit: Pauline Shaw and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Facts Are These”.
Details some of the stresses, strains and speed of modern living which have made mental illness a common occurrence. Types of treatment and care of the mentally ill are explained.

results.title: Caring for the future
results.creator_credit: Jim Hayes and State Electricity Commission of Victoria
results.brief_description: As demands for electricity is doubled every ten years, the State Electricity Commission of Victoria must plan at least ten years ahead. The film shows the planning that went into the Loy Yang Power plant, when more than fifty interested bodies were consulted and a great deal of careful testing and experimentation was carried out before the final plan was put into action.

results.title: Caribbean
results.creator_credit: Central Office of Information, Crown Film Unit
results.brief_description: Made before the Federation of the islands of the West Indies, this film shows the people, customs, export products, social problems, and scenery of the British West Indies, British Guiana, and British Honduras. Interwoven with a musical background of calypso music ritual drumming, ancient folk songs and traditional dance rhythms. (Awards: 1st prize Venice Film Festival 1951)
